metadata.title: CVE-2022-25258 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in drivers/usb/gadget/composite.c in the Linuxkernel before 5.16.10. The USB Gadget subsystem lacks certain validation ofinterface OS descriptor requests (ones with a large array index and onesassociated with NULL function pointer retrieval). Memory corruption mightoccur.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-25258` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-3.11.0-12-generic-lpae - 3.11.0-12.19
linux-image-extra-3.11.0-12-generic - 3.11.0-12.19
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-generic - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-230-lowlatency - 4.4.0-230.264~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-4.4.0-1110-aws - 4.4.0-1110.116
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1138-azure - 4.15.0-1138.151~14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro
